intro: Kohleria incana, commonly known as the silverleaf kohleria, is a species native to South America, particularly Brazil. It is a flowering plant belonging to the Gesneriaceae family, known for its ornamental value. The plant features fleshy, lance-shaped leaves that are typically covered in a silvery or grayish pubescence. Its flowers are tubular and often come in shades of pink or white, blooming in late spring to early summer. Kohleria incana thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often cultivated as a houseplant due to its attractive appearance and relatively easy care requirements.
